I've been looking over the posts here and feel that since a lot of people think that gays shouldn't be able to marry eachother, raise children, serve in the military, that perhaps they shouldn't have to pay taxes...
 
 what do you think?

post_info.post_title: Gays Shouldn't Have the Right to Pay Taxes

I've been looking over the posts here and feel that since a lot of people think that gays shouldn't be able to marry eachother, raise children, serve in the military, that perhaps they shouldn't have to pay taxes...
 
 what do you think?

 
 After reading some of the responses to civil rights, morality, polygamy etc., I can't wait to hear the Christian Crusader rationalizations on this one.

Honestly, I think bringing up the topic only distracts from serious issues. If anything, it's likely to push fence sitters away from the pro gay rights camp.
 
 I know the pace of civil rights progress seems slow at times, but only by staying focused on serious issues will progress be made. Making suggestions that won't, and shouldn't, happen make real suggestions seem less reasonable by association. At least, that's how I see it.
